body.p: You From the commencement of the unhappy hostilities now pending in the Un County the people of Kentucky have indicated an earnest desire and purpose as far as lay in their power to ^while^ maintain^ing^ their original political status, to do nothing by which to involve themselves in the war. Up to this time they have succeeded in securing to themselves and to the State domestic peace and internal tranquility, as the fruits of the position assumed. My object now is to promote the continuance of those blessings to the people of this state.

Until within a brief period the people of this state were tranquil and calm, free from domestic strife and internal commotion. They have done nothing resisted no law, rebelled against no authority, engaged in no revolution or insurrection but constantly proclaimed their purpose quietly to pursue their peaceful avocations, earnestly hoping their own soil would be spared the presence of armed troops and the scene of conflict be kept removed from the
border of their state. By thus giving no occassion for the introduction of bodies of soldiers and furnishing offering no provocation or just cause for the presence the of millitary force they have labored to preserve the in this state the public peace and avoid the calamities of hostile blody hostilities. I request that Recently a large body of soldiers has been enlisted into the United states Army and collected in a military camps in the central portion of the state. This movement was preceded by the intr introduction ^into the State^ of public arms and munitions of war distributed exclusively to a class of the people, and the active organization of companies Regiments &c conpared^sisting^ of men sworn into the U. S. service under officers holding commissions from Yourself. Its ordnance and munitions of war are being brought transported into the state and placed in their camps. In a word an Army is now being organized and quartered within this state supplied with all the arms & munitions of war, and that internal tranquility so earnestly sought to be maintained by the people of Kentucky, and succcessfully

In the name therefore of their In view therefore of the people, and with a single & earnest desire to from their present peaceful fireside & tranquil home the horrors of civil war I appeal to you to remove from the limits of Kentucky the forces now organized & in camp be within their state, and that you to arrest the introduction ^into the state^ of munitions war and troops, arms & munitions of war -- A favorable response will as I firmly believe secure to this the people of Kentucky power & the blessings of peace and protect the state from the blo surging conflicts -- now spreading ruin & within other states.
